0P000073A1.TO.summary: The Fund's objective is to provide long-term growth of capital by investing primarily in the securities markets of Asia considered by the Manager to be undervalued. Investments may be made in securities markets outside of Asia. Investments may include common and preferred shares, convertible debentures, government and corporate bonds and short term indebtedness.

0P0000A0EX.TO.summary: VPI Value Poolâs objective is to provide unitholders with long-term growth while preserving capital. VPI Value Pool invests in North American and international-based equity securities.
0P0000A0EX.TO.manager_bio: Gordon began his career with Manufacturers Life Insurance Company where he worked between 1989 and 1995, gaining experience in the area of foreign exchange, securities analysis, trading and portfolio management. Gordon is a member of the Advisory Board of Waterloo Tech Capital, a venture capital fund specializing in Waterloo based technology companies. He is also on the Investment Committee of the United Church of Canada Pension Fund.

0P0001A932.TO.manager_bio: Andrew joined BMO Asset Management Inc.âs active fixed income team as a portfolio manager in 2005, & has over 20 yrs experience in managing fixed income portfolios. Andrew overseas portfolios with an emphasis on the interest anticipation aspects of govmt bond sectors. Andrew holds an Honours BCom degree from the University of Windsor, a Bachelor of Arts degree (Economics) from the University of Western Ont & received his CFA designation in 1999.

0P0001A934.TO.long_name: BMO Risk Reduction Equity Fund Advisor Series
0P0001A934.TO.summary: This fundâs objective is to seek to preserve the value of your investment, to provide the potential for growth and to reduce portfolio volatility as compared to the broader global equity market by investing primarily, directly or indirectly, in global equity securities and/or derivatives.
0P0001A934.TO.manager_bio: Chris has more than fourteen years of experience in the investment industry and currently serves as portfolio manager for derivative-based and equity-based portfolios. He has taken on numerous roles since joining BMO in 2002, including Manager of Investments for BMO Asset Management Inc. where he was responsible for mutual fund manager monitoring and selection. In this role, he was also responsible for overseeing the currency hedging program across the mutual fund platform. Chris holds a BBA from York University's Schulich School of Business and is a CFA Charterholder.
